item.title: Budget 2026 swaps crisis-fighting for reform rhetoric but leaves growth to execution
item.description: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake‚Äôs second Budget locks in IMF-style consolidation while signalling a pivot to investment-led growth. Business, from the Ceylon Chamber to apparel brands, welcomed policy stability but asked for faster, clearer implementation, especially on trade facilitation, SOE/PPP laws and investor incentives. The sting is the VAT net widening (threshold down to Rs. 36m) and a still-modest capital push. item.title: Democracy and devolution return to the front burner as PCs languish and reparations stall
item.description: The long-frozen Provincial Council (PC) polls resurfaced after former Election Commissioner Mahinda Deshapriya flagged a Supreme Court dictum that Governors cannot run provinces indefinitely. Meanwhile ITAK warned the President that appointing more ex-security officials to the Office of Reparations would gut credibility‚Äîthree of five members would be from security services if two nominees go through. In parallel, academics questioned rushed psychometric testing in schools and warned of the pitfalls of high-stakes literacy/numeracy regimes.
